DataElement.preferredName: In Situ Hybridization DNA Probe Exact Display Other Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field used to describe how the specificity of the probe was displayed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues_A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues

Concepts.definition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

Concepts.definition: A piece of DNA that has been labeled, usually radioactively or with a fluorescent dye, which is used in hybridization studies.  Applications include Northern and Southern blots, in situ hybridization techniques, and diagnostic tests.  DNA probes can be highly specific or degenerate.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that describes how the probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. .

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Marked by strict and particular and complete accordance with fact.:Display; exhibiting openly in public view; a visual representation of something.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
Marked by strict and particular and complete accordance with fact.
Exhibit, present, or demonstrate for viewing.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
